means: 撒小谎( fib的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He laughs loudly when I accuse him of fibbing.
sentence.Network_cn: 当我指责他说谎时，他大笑起来。

sentence.Network_en: I told him that I ate the whole pie, but I was only fibbing.
sentence.Network_cn: 我告诉他我整个馅饼都吃了, 其实我不过是撒了个小谎.

sentence.Network_en: Mary was caught fibbing. She sure spread it on thick.
sentence.Network_cn: 玛丽的谎话被戳穿了. 她必然要讨好别人.

list.abs: Ddaffy fib 讲大话daily grind 每日例行苦工
He told a fib so he could leave early ., 他撒了一个小谎 , 以便早些离开.
technical indicators don't work . they're a big fib to appease retail traders .多数技术指标不起作用。它们对多数散户交易者是一个大陷阱。。
her clumsy fib had let him see that she had something to conceal .她那愚蠢的谎言已使他猜出她在隐瞒什么。

entry.def: A fib is a small, unimportant lie.

example.ex: She told innocent fibs like anyone else.
example.tran: 她也像别人一样，说些无伤大雅的谎话。

entry.def: If someone is fibbing, they are telling lies.

example.ex: He laughs loudly when I accuse him of fibbing.
example.tran: 当我指责他说谎时，他大笑起来。

means.word_mean: 1. a trivial act of lying or being deliberately unclear

auth_sentence.content: Dermot O'Leary, his hands miming the classic fibbing fisherman action.

auth_sentence.content: Max was getting good at the fibbing, so this one was easy.

auth_sentence.content: That reduces fibbing and helps executives learn how to drive more value from IT.
